episodeTitle: Lost in the Deep Sea! The Straw Hats Get Separated!
japanesTitle: 深海で遭難 逸れた麦わらの一味
romanizedTitle: Shinkai de Sōnan - Hagureta Mugiwara no Ichimi
description: The Monster Trio battles a Kraken while showcasing their new post-timeskip abilities. After defeating it, Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji become separated from the crew. The remaining Straw Hats navigate dangerous deep-sea waters filled with massive sea creatures while Franky deals with the stowaway Caribou.

events.title: Monster Trio vs Kraken Battle Begins
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji leave the Thousand Sunny in Flutter Kick Coating bubbles to confront the massive Kraken threatening the ship. The three prepare to showcase their post-timeskip abilities against the deep-sea creature.
events.significance: Marks the first major battle showcasing the Monster Trio's enhanced abilities after the two-year timeskip, demonstrating their growth and new techniques.

events.title: Sanji Debuts Blue Walk
events.description: Sanji demonstrates his new ability Blue Walk (Sky Walk underwater variant), allowing him to move freely in the water despite the coating bubble. This technique was developed during his two-year training.
events.significance: Showcases Sanji's training results and his adaptation of Sky Walk for underwater combat, expanding his combat versatility.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji demonstrates his new underwater movement technique

events.title: Sanji Debuts Diable Jambe: Bien Cuit
events.description: Sanji unleashes an enhanced version of his Diable Jambe technique called Bien Cuit (Well Cooked), burning one of the Kraken's tentacles with intensified flames. This demonstrates the evolution of his signature fire-based attacks.
events.significance: Shows the advancement of Sanji's Diable Jambe technique, with greater heat and power than before the timeskip.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji unleashes his enhanced fire kick on the Kraken

events.title: Zoro Debuts Santoryu Ogi: Rokudo no Tsuji
events.description: Zoro reveals his new Three Sword Style Secret Technique: Rokudo no Tsuji (Six Paths Crossroads), severing another of the Kraken's tentacles with devastating precision. This marks his first post-timeskip ultimate technique.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's mastery of Three Sword Style after training with Mihawk, showcasing a powerful new finishing move.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro unleashes his new ultimate technique to cut the Kraken

events.title: Luffy Uses Armament Haki for the First Time
events.description: Luffy demonstrates Busoshoku Haki (Armament Haki) for the first time in the anime, hardening his enlarged Gear Third arm to a dark, shiny black appearance before striking the Kraken.
events.significance: First visual demonstration of Armament Haki in the anime, marking a major power-up for Luffy and introducing a fundamental combat mechanic that will define future battles.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy combines Gear Third with Armament Haki for a devastating attack

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gun Debut
events.description: Luffy unleashes his new signature attack, Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gun, a Gear Third technique enhanced with Armament Haki. The massive hardened fist knocks out the Kraken with a single devastating blow.
events.significance: Introduces Luffy's first Haki-imbued named technique, combining Gear Third's power with Armament Haki's hardening effect. This becomes one of his signature post-timeskip attacks.

events.title: Kraken Defeated and Tamed
events.description: After being knocked unconscious by Luffy's Elephant Gun, the Kraken awakens and is intimidated by Luffy's presence. Luffy names the Kraken 'Surume' and successfully tames it through a combination of strength and charisma.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's natural ability to win over even fearsome creatures, establishing Surume as a temporary ally who will guide them toward Fish-Man Island.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy names the Kraken after taming it

events.title: Caribou Trapped in Barrel
events.description: Franky discovers Caribou, who had snuck into a barrel on the Thousand Sunny, plotting to kill the Straw Hats. After hearing Caribou's scheming, Franky seals him inside the barrel to prevent any harm.
events.significance: Introduces Caribou as a stowaway antagonist and sets up his continued presence throughout the Fish-Man Island arc.

events.title: Entering the Undersea Volcanic Region
events.description: The Thousand Sunny enters a dangerous area filled with undersea volcanoes and massive sea creatures. The crew becomes nervous as they navigate through this treacherous environment without the Monster Trio.
events.significance: Heightens tension and showcases the dangers of the deep sea route to Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Multiple Coup de Burst Uses
events.description: To escape from massive sea creatures in the volcanic region, Franky is forced to use Coup de Burst four times in succession. However, each use causes the protective bubble around the ship to shrink, creating a dangerous situation.
events.significance: Demonstrates the limitations of Coup de Burst underwater and creates urgency as the crew's protection diminishes.

events.title: Megalo Debut
events.description: The shark Megalo makes his first appearance in the anime as the Monster Trio follows him toward Fish-Man Island after defeating the Kraken.
events.significance: Introduces Megalo, who will play an important role in the Fish-Man Island arc as Princess Shirahoshi's companion.

events.title: Ankoro Debut
events.description: The sea creature Ankoro appears as one of the massive creatures threatening the Thousand Sunny in the undersea volcanic region.
events.significance: Adds to the variety of dangerous deep-sea fauna encountered on the journey to Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Giant Anglerfish Attack
events.description: A massive anglerfish emerges and attempts to swallow the Thousand Sunny whole. The crew barely escapes from its jaws, highlighting the increasing danger of their deep-sea journey.
events.significance: Creates tension and demonstrates the crew's vulnerability without their strongest fighters.

events.title: Wadatsumi Debut
events.description: The giant fish-man Wadatsumi makes his first appearance, knocking out the anglerfish that was attacking the Thousand Sunny. His massive size and strength are immediately apparent.
events.significance: Introduces Wadatsumi as a significant new character who will play a major role in the Fish-Man Island arc as a member of the Flying Pirates.

events.title: Flying Dutchman Appears
events.description: The episode ends with the ominous appearance of the Flying Dutchman, the ghost ship captained by Vander Decken IX. The mysterious vessel looms in the darkness of the deep sea.
events.significance: Introduces the Flying Dutchman and foreshadows the arrival of Vander Decken IX, a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island arc. Creates suspense for the next episode.

events.title: Vander Decken IX Silhouette
events.description: As the Flying Dutchman appears, the silhouette of its captain Vander Decken IX is briefly visible, though his full appearance is not yet revealed.
events.significance: Teases the introduction of Vander Decken IX, who will become a central antagonist in the Fish-Man Island arc with his obsession with Princess Shirahoshi.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Attacking the Kraken with enhanced fire kick

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: First use of Armament Haki with Gear Third

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Naming the Kraken after taming it

themes.description: The episode showcases the results of the Straw Hats' two-year training, particularly the Monster Trio's dramatic power increases. Each member demonstrates new techniques that represent their dedication and growth.
themes.symbolism: The Kraken represents the first major challenge to test their new abilities, serving as a benchmark for how far they've come.

themes.description: The physical separation of the Monster Trio from the rest of the crew tests the abilities of the other members to handle dangers on their own, highlighting their individual growth as well.
themes.symbolism: The deep sea represents the unknown challenges ahead, with each group facing their own trials.

themes.description: The introduction of visible Armament Haki marks a fundamental shift in the series' power system, establishing a new tier of combat that will define the New World battles.
themes.symbolism: The black hardening of Luffy's arm symbolizes the 'invisible armor' becoming visible, representing tangible proof of his training.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his mastery of Armament Haki, showing he's ready for New World challenges. His ability to tame the Kraken reflects his natural charisma and strength.
keyActions: Uses Armament Haki for the first time
Defeats Kraken with Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gun

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro reveals his enhanced Three Sword Style techniques learned from training with Mihawk, showing he's progressed toward his goal of becoming the world's greatest swordsman.
keyActions: Severs Kraken tentacle with Santoryu Ogi: Rokudo no Tsuji
Follows Megalo with Luffy and Sanji

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji demonstrates two new techniques from his training: Blue Walk for underwater mobility and an enhanced Diable Jambe, showing his growth as a fighter.
keyActions: Burns Kraken with Diable Jambe: Bien Cuit

characterSpotlights.development: Franky takes responsibility for protecting the crew in the Monster Trio's absence, using Coup de Burst multiple times and dealing with the Caribou threat.
keyActions: Uses Coup de Burst four times to escape dangers
Navigates the ship through the undersea volcanic region

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, Franky seals Caribou immediately after spotting him. In the anime, Caribou notices Franky and attempts to hide in the barrel again before being sealed.
The anime includes flashback scenes showing Zoro and Sanji's training during the timeskip, which were not shown at this point in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first visual demonstration of Armament Haki in the anime, introducing the iconic black hardening effect that becomes a signature visual element.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 12.9%, ranking #2 in its time slot during its original broadcast in Japan.
This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 605 and 606, with Chapter 605 pages 7, 11-19 and Chapter 606 pages 2-12.
Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gun becomes one of Luffy's signature attacks throughout the Fish-Man Island arc and beyond, being used in numerous critical battles.
The opening theme 'We Go!' was created by the same 'Golden Team' (Hiroshi Kitadani, Shoko Fujibayashi, Kohei Tanaka, and Takayuki Negishi) that created the original 'We Are!' opening.
